section.title:
to-do lists creating new to-dos
customer relationship management creating to-dos for New To-Do List Item
section.para: To enter a new To-Do item, select the "New To-Do Item" option. The following screen will appear:
When entering a new To-Do item, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Enter a name to describe the Task. Duplicate Task Names are allowed.
Select to indicate the To-Do item is active.
Enter a brief description of the To-Do item.
Enter a priority from the drop down list to help you prioritize your To-Do items. Priority options include, Very High, High, Normal, Low, Very Low
By default, a new To-Do item is owned by the user who creates it. Once a To-Do item has been created, it may be reassigned to another user.
To assign a To-Do item to another user, use the lookup feature located to the right of the field.
Specify the date when the To-Do item is due.
Specify the date when the To-Do item was assigned—or reassigned.
Specify the date when work on the To-Do item was started.
Specify the date when work on the To-Do item was completed.
Select to indicate the To-Do item is pending input. To-Do items having this status will display a "P" in the status column when they appear on the To-Do List.
Select to indicate the To-Do item is deferred. To-Do items having this status will display a "D" in the status column when they appear on the To-Do List.
Select to indicate the To-Do item is neither pending input nor deferred. To-Do items having this status will display an "I" in the status column when they appear on the To-Do List.

Select to indicate you want the To-Do item to be a recurring To-Do item, using the frequency settings you specify below. This feature enables you to automatically generate copies of To-Do items on a recurring basis (e.g., the same day of every month). Recurring To-Do items are generated when you run the recurring items utility, which is described in more detail here: .
Specify how frequently you want the To-Do item to recur. For example, once (1) per month, six (6) times per year, etc.
Specify when the recurrence should stop. For example, on the last day of the year, at the end of six months, etc.
Specify the maximum number of To-Do item copies you want created when the recurring items utility is run.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without creating a To-Do item, returning you to the previous screen.
Creates the To-Do item and adds it to the To-Do List.

section.para: To enter notes for a To-Do Item, select the "Notes" tab at the bottom of the screen, as shown below:

listitem.para: This is a scrolling text field with word-wrapping for entering Notes related to the To-Do item.

section.para: To create associations for a To-Do Item to other records, select the "Relationships" tab at the bottom of the screen, as shown below:
When defining To-Do Item relationships, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Specify the CRM Account the To-Do item is associated with (if any).
Select an Opportunity (if applicable) to associate with the To-Do Item.
Select an Incident (if applicable) to associate with the To-Do Item.

section.para: To create reminder Alarms for a To-Do Item, select the "Alarms" tab at the bottom of the screen, as shown below:
When creating reminder Alarms for To-Do Items, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Displays a list of Alarms you can create to send reminders to various users associated with an Event or system message.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Opens screen for entering new Alarm information.
Enables you to edit highlighted Alarm. The edit screen is the same as that for entering new Alarm information—except that when editing, the fields will contain Alarm information.
Highlight an Alarm and then select this button to reach a read-only view of the "Edit" screen. Double-clicking on an Alarm will also bring you to the view screen.
Highlight an Alarm Item and then select this button to remove the Alarm Item from the list.
